cont.entity_a: The system worked well initially but requires frequent reboots by physically disconnecting from the power source. Firmware update is necessary for optimal performance. Firmware upgrades improve performance.
cont.entity_b: Router stopped working after a few months and was not repairable after warranty expired. Requires rebooting once a day.

cont.entity_a: Advertised range of 300ft is questionable, with poor signal quality at around 80ft. Router provides good signal reception up to 40 feet. Range is limited to about 30 feet indoors. Wireless range is limited and inconsistent through walls. Wireless option has poor reception beyond 15-20 feet.
cont.entity_b: Signal strength reduces if there are walls between the laptop and router.
Had issues with shared mode and DNS passthrough. Setup may require assistance unless the user is an IT professional.

cont.entity_a: Device cannot support more than one Xbox connected to Xbox Live at a time. Device does not support Macintosh systems well, with inadequate instructions and support. Router is not compatible with Macs and offers limited support.
cont.entity_b: Does not work with DSL modems. Works with cable internet connection.

cont.entity_a: Router and software installed easily, with good connection strength at up to 75 feet. Installation is easy, but the wireless range is limited. Router is easy to install but has buggy firmware. Router is easy to set up and works well with both PCs and Macs.
cont.entity_b: Easy to set up and use in locations without wireless.

cont.entity_a: User guide lacks key information and is incomplete for non-Windows 98 & ME systems. Configuration is easy once set up, but documentation is poor.

cont.entity_b: Router gets hot and should not be covered. Router is small and easy to hide. Lightweight with its own carry case.

cont.entity_a: Router is defective if a computer on the network reboots.
Router supports only one IPSec pass-through session. Router lacks static DHCP feature.

cont.entity_b: Good for traveling and sharing a hotel room network.
WEP configuration was difficult, but WPA was easy.
